databaseModule

Class DbFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • databaseModule.DbFunctions

  • public class DbFunctions
extends Object
    A collection of functions that relate to working directly with the database.
    Version:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    ActianceEngInterns

    • Constructor Detail

      • DbFunctions

        public DbFunctions()

    • Method Detail

      • populate

        public static long populate(String path)
        Feeds parsed Documents into the database and generates cache of normalized server configuration files and data.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the root directory containing the files to be cached (i.e. a compatible directory structure, as outlined in the README and Dev Guide)
        Returns:
        the number of properties added to the database

      • ignore

        public static void ignore(String location,
                          Set<String> properties,
                          boolean toggle)
        Given a filter and set of properties, updates the "ignore" field for each property matching the filter to the optionally-specified value.
        Parameters:
        location - a specific path within which to ignore a property
        properties - a Set containing the keys of each property to be ignored
        toggle - true if the properties are to be ignored, else false

      • printStructure

        public static void printStructure(String path,
                                  int level)
        Prints the directory structure of the files within the database at an optionally-specified scope.
        Parameters:
        path - a specific branch of the structure to print
        level - the level to which the structure is being printed

      • popTree

        public static DirTree popTree()
        Generates DirTrees of the complete directory structure within the database.
        Returns:
        the generated DirTree, a representation of the complete directory structure within the database

      • printInfo

        public static void printInfo()
        Gives a high-level summary of the contents of the database (i.e. number of environments, fabrics, nodes, files).

      • getIgnored

        public static Set<String> getIgnored()
        Getter method for the database properties set to be ignored.
        Returns:
        a Set containing all the properties with the "ignore" field marked as "true"
